keypoints.text: A 6 carbon ring of alternating single and double bonds
Kekule explained Benzene's unreactivity by hypothesizing that the structure is in constant equilibrium
Application of the constant equilibrium of the structure to Benzene's attraction to Br2

front: Describe the delocalized model of benzene

keypoints.text: Every carbon has 120 triganol planar bond angles
Each carbon forms a sigma bond with another 2 carbons
Leaving 1 electron that forms a delocalized PI bond over all 6 electrons

front: Give the evidence for the delocalized model of Benzene

keypoints.text: Bond lengths of benzene are all the same
Enthalpy change of hydrogenation is not the amount Kekule's model predicts
